snippet: China Central Television said investigators would begin examining the ship in an effort to determine the cause of the accident, one of Asia’s worst maritime disasters in decades.
abstract: Authorities recover nearly 300 more bodies from cruise ship that capsized in Yangtze River in China; officials say they will continue searching for over 40 passengers who remain missing among original 456.

byline.contributor: Huang Yufan and Kiki Zhao contributed research.

lead_paragraph: China Central Television said investigators would begin examining the ship in an effort to determine the cause of the accident, one of Asia’s worst maritime disasters in decades.

headline.main: 300 More Bodies Found in China Ship Disaster
headline.print_headline: Hundreds More Bodies Found in China Disaster
